column4: question. I have a windows NFS share, but when I create a directory on it from a linux system, the folder is inaccessible from the Windows system.. "Windows cannot access \\NFS-share\folder"..
I realize its an issue with permission, but not quite sure how to fix it=?
fairly certain you need to use samba for that.
unfortunately, I need to use NFS :/
Im thinking there must be an easy chmod command from the linux box to fix it?
what
the problem must be that the files/folders created on the Windows NFS share from the Linux box have the linux root user as owner
you want to change the owner of the files/directories?
idk if that will fix it..
me neither, but worth a try. "chown newonwer file/directory" by the way.
yea, thanks, however, I have no idea what owner to set
just your own user?
but Linux doesnt use the same access control system as Windows
you need to access it from Windows as well?
thats the problem here.. I have a Windows NFS Share which works fine, but I cannot access folders created from Linux systems on the Windows box
I see. I don't think Windows recognises Linux permissions.
exactly.. so there must be a way to work around this somehow
I wonder if my mount command for the NFS share is the issue?
might be. Should probably mount it as a user account, although not sure if that will hell.
not _as_ as a user account, but connect it to one.
local partition or over network?
never mind, I can't read.
